page.title: 10BRILL C.of E.COMBINED SCHOOL
page.content: Brill Church of England Combined School has 102 boys and girls between 5 and 11 years in 4 classes.The 4 full-time tea- chers include the headmaster.Most chil -dren then go to Lord Williams's Comp- rehensive School in Thame.2 of the 5 governors are appointed by the church, 2 by the county council and 1 by the parish council.The present school build -ing was built in 1974 and the swimming pool in 1975.There has been a school in Brill since 1815.Lessons include maths, PE,English,RE,history,music,science, geography and games.These are football, netball,rounders,chinese cricket and cricket.The PTA raises money for extra equipment.Parents run pottery and sewing clubs and cycling proficiency lessons.Teachers organise recorder and guitar lessons and computer.School lunches cost 75p a day.Special events are sports day,concerts,harvest etc..
